title: Josep Ferré
text:
Josep María Ferré Ybarz (born 26 November 1986), sometimes known as Coco, is a Spanish <a href="association%20football">football</a> <a href="Manager%20%28association%20football%29">manager</a>.
Coaching career.
Ferré began his coaching career in the academy of <a href="CE%20Europa">CE Europa</a>. Subsequently he worked in the academy of <a href="CE%20Premi%C3%A0">CE Premià</a> before working in <a href="FC%20Barcelona">FC Barcelona</a> Escola. After working with FCB Escola, he went to Thailand where he worked as academy director in <a href="Buriram%20United">Buriram United</a> where he also coached the "B" team. In 2015 he coached <a href="Ratchaburi%20Mitr%20Phol%20F.C.">Ratchaburi Mitr Phol F.C.</a> In 2018 he coached in <a href="Bangkok%20Glass">Bangkok Glass</a>. In September 2018, he was appointed as head coach in <a href="Bayam%C3%B3n%20FC">Bayamón FC</a> which plays at <a href="Liga%20Puerto%20Rico">Liga Puerto Rico</a>. In 2019, he has been appointed as an assistant coach and video analyst in <a href="East%20Bengal%20F.C.">East Bengal F.C.</a> which plays at <a href="I-League">I-League</a>. 
On 21 January 2020, he stepped down from <a href="East%20Bengal%20F.C.">East Bengal F.C.</a>.
